docs.lead_paragraph: Turkey said on Saturday it would keep holding rallies in Germany and the Netherlands to urge Turks living there to back a vote to boost President Tayyip Erdogan's powers, despite opposition from authorities in both countries.

headline.print_headline: Turkey Plans More Pro-Erdogan Rallies, German Concerns Mount
headline.main: Turkey Plans More Pro-Erdogan Rallies, German Concerns Mount

docs.snippet: Turkey said on Saturday it would keep holding rallies in Germany and the Netherlands to urge Turks living there to back a vote to boost President Tayyip Erdogan's powers, despite opposition from authorities in both countries....

docs.lead_paragraph: The New York governor will meet with political and business leaders in Jerusalem, with an itinerary that is heavy on symbolism and light on down time.

headline.print_headline: Cuomo, Citing ‘Wave of Anti-Semitism,’ Visits Israel
headline.main: Cuomo, Citing ‘Wave of Anti-Semitism,’ Pays Impromptu Visit to Israel

docs.snippet: The New York governor will meet with political and business leaders in Jerusalem, with an itinerary that is heavy on symbolism and light on down time....

docs.lead_paragraph: French presidential candidate Francois Fillon, fighting for political survival, called on supporters Saturday not to "abdicate" to those trying to destroy him as the Socialist mayor of Paris asked him to cancel a scheduled rally that would test his staying power.

headline.print_headline: Paris Mayor Asks Struggling Candidate to Cancel His Rally
headline.main: Paris Mayor Asks Struggling Candidate to Cancel His Rally

docs.lead_paragraph: Manchester United wasted the chance to move into the top five of the Premier League as their League Cup-winning hero Zlatan Ibrahimovic missed a penalty and 10-man Bournemouth battled to snatch an eventful 1-1 draw at Old Trafford on Saturday.

headline.print_headline: Manchester United Held as Zlatan Misfires, Leicester Win Again
headline.main: Manchester United Held as Zlatan Misfires, Leicester Win Again

docs.lead_paragraph: Minnesota Gov. Mark Dayton will spend one more day at the Mayo Clinic in Rochester after undergoing surgery for prostate cancer.

docs.lead_paragraph: British anti-doping authorities condemned the leaking of information "which only serves to fuel rumor and innuendo" on Saturday after the latest media report surrounding athlete Mo Farah and his American coach Alberto Salazar.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Philippines on Saturday said it was committed to human rights and condemned extrajudicial killings but said those were "not to be confused" with incidents in its war on drugs, after a U.S. State Department report voiced concern about such deaths.

headline.print_headline: Philippines Says Condemns Extrajudicial Killings, but None During Drugs War
headline.main: Philippines Says Condemns Extrajudicial Killings, but None During Drugs War

docs.lead_paragraph: Democratic Republic of Congo's largest opposition party said it expelled one of its leaders on Saturday amid infighting that weakens its effort to force President Joseph Kabila to stick to a deal to step down after an election this year.

headline.print_headline: Congo Opposition Party Expels Top Official in Sign of Infighting
headline.main: Congo Opposition Party Expels Top Official in Sign of Infighting

docs.snippet: Democratic Republic of Congo's largest opposition party said it expelled one of its leaders on Saturday amid infighting that weakens its effort to force President Joseph Kabila to stick to a deal to step down after an election this year....

docs.lead_paragraph: Real Madrid overcame the absence of Gareth Bale and Cristiano Ronaldo to romp to a 4-1 win at tiny Eibar on Saturday and provisionally return to the top of La Liga.

headline.print_headline: Real Madrid Thrash Eibar Without Bale and Ronaldo
headline.main: Real Madrid Thrash Eibar Without Bale and Ronaldo

docs.snippet: Real Madrid overcame the absence of Gareth Bale and Cristiano Ronaldo to romp to a 4-1 win at tiny Eibar on Saturday and provisionally return to the top of La Liga....

docs.lead_paragraph: Turkish officials said that an aircraft believed to belong to the Syrian military crashed near the Turkey-Syria border Saturday, with the Syrian opposition claiming to Turkish media they were responsible for shooting the plane down.

headline.print_headline: Plane Believed to Be Syrian Crashes Near Turkey-Syria Border
headline.main: Plane Believed to Be Syrian Crashes Near Turkey-Syria Border

docs.snippet: Turkish officials said that an aircraft believed to belong to the Syrian military crashed near the Turkey-Syria border Saturday, with the Syrian opposition claiming to Turkish media they were responsible for shooting the plane down....
